    trading_logic Package¶

    class src.trading_logic.strategy_manager.StrategyManager(technical_strategies, additional_strategies=None)¶

    Bases: object

    Manages and applies various trading strategies to market data.

    The StrategyManager class orchestrates the application of multiple trading strategies (both technical and additional) to a given dataset. It facilitates the integration of different strategies, allowing for a consolidated approach to generating trading signals.

    Parameters:

    • technical_strategies (Dict[str, Callable[[Series], Any]]) –

    • additional_strategies (Dict[str, Callable[[Series], Any]] | None) –

    technical_strategies¶

    A dictionary mapping strategy names to their corresponding technical strategy functions.

    Type:

    Dict[str, Callable[[pd.Series], Any]]

    additional_strategies¶

    An optional dictionary mapping strategy names to their corresponding additional strategy functions.

    Type:

    Dict[str, Callable[[pd.Series], Any]]

    apply_strategies(data)¶

    Applies all available trading strategies to the given market data.

    This method processes each row of the input DataFrame by applying each configured trading strategy. The results are appended as new columns to the DataFrame, representing the signals generated by each strategy.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – A DataFrame containing market data. It is expected to have one row per time period and columns corresponding to various market indicators and features.

    Returns:

    A copy of the input DataFrame augmented with new columns representing the signals generated by each trading strategy. The columns are named after the respective strategies.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    class src.trading_logic.trade_execution_manager.TradeExecutionManager(base_path, symbols_file, strategy_manager, trade_simulator)¶

    Bases: object

    Manages the execution of trading strategies by handling data loading, strategy application, and trade simulation.

    The TradeExecutionManager class orchestrates the complete trade cycle, which includes:

    1. Loading historical market data for specified symbols.

    2. Applying trading strategies to generate signals.

    3. Simulating trades based on generated signals.

    Parameters:

    • base_path (str) –

    • symbols_file (str) –

    • strategy_manager (StrategyManager) –

    • trade_simulator (TradeSimulator) –

    base_path¶

    Directory containing the CSV files with historical data.

    Type:

    str

    symbols¶

    List of stock symbols to process.

    Type:

    List[str]

    strategy_manager¶

    Instance responsible for applying trading strategies.

    Type:

    StrategyManager

    trade_simulator¶

    Instance responsible for simulating trade executions.

    Type:

    TradeSimulator

    execute_trade_cycle()¶

    Executes the complete trade cycle, which includes data loading, strategy execution, and trade simulation.

    Return type:

    None

    The method performs the following steps:

    1. Loads historical market data for all specified symbols.

    2. Applies all configured trading strategies to generate signals.

    3. Iterates over each row of the data with signals and executes trades based on the ‘Majority_Vote_Strategy’ signal.

    Raises:

    KeyError – If the ‘Majority_Vote_Strategy’ column is missing in the data.

    Return type:

    None

    load_data()¶

    Loads and concatenates historical data for all specified symbols.

    It reads CSV files for each symbol from the base_path directory. Each CSV file is expected to contain historical market data for a specific symbol. The method adds a ‘symbol’ column to each DataFrame for identification and concatenates all data into a single DataFrame.

    Returns:

    A concatenated DataFrame containing historical data for all symbols.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    Raises:

    FileNotFoundError – If no data files are found in the specified directory.

    class src.trading_logic.trade_simulator.TradeSimulator(initial_capital=10000.0, transaction_cost=20.0)¶

    Bases: object

    Simulates trade executions based on generated trading signals.

    The TradeSimulator class manages the execution of trades by handling positions, calculating shares to trade, managing capital, applying transaction costs, and recording trade history. It supports both BACKTEST and LIVE trading modes.

    Parameters:

    • initial_capital (float) –

    • transaction_cost (float) –

    mode¶

    Operational mode (‘BACKTEST’ or ‘LIVE’).

    Type:

    str

    initial_capital¶

    Starting capital for trading.

    Type:

    float

    transaction_cost¶

    Fixed cost per transaction.

    Type:

    float

    positions¶

    Dictionary tracking current positions per symbol.

    Type:

    Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]

    trade_history¶

    List recording the history of executed trades.

    Type:

    List[Dict[str, Any]]

    calculate_dynamic_trailing_stop_loss(current_price, entry_price, position_type)¶

    Calculates a dynamic trailing stop loss percentage based on the return.

    Parameters:

    • current_price (float) – Current price of the stock.

    • entry_price (float) – Entry price of the stock.

    • position_type (str) – Type of position (‘long’ or ‘short’).

    Returns:

    Trailing stop loss percentage.

    Return type:

    float

    Raises:

    ValueError – If the position type is invalid.

    calculate_holding_time(exit_date, entry_date)¶

    Calculates the holding time of a trade.

    Parameters:

    • exit_date (str) – Date and time when the trade was closed.

    • entry_date (str) – Date and time when the trade was opened.

    Returns:

    Holding time in days.

    Return type:

    float

    Raises:

    ValueError – If date formats are incorrect.

    calculate_shares(price, position_type)¶

    Calculates the number of shares to trade based on the current capital and position type.

    Parameters:

    • price (float) – Current price of the stock.

    • position_type (str) – Type of position (‘long’ or ‘short’).

    Returns:

    Number of shares to trade.

    Return type:

    int

    Raises:

    ValueError – If the position type is invalid.

    check_trailing_stop_loss(symbol, current_price, date)¶

    Checks and applies trailing stop loss conditions for a given symbol.

    Parameters:

    • symbol (str) – Stock symbol to check.

    • current_price (float) – Current price of the stock.

    • date (str) – Current date and time.

    Raises:

    ValueError – If the symbol does not have an open position.

    Return type:

    None

    close_position(symbol, price, date)¶

    Closes an existing position for a given symbol.

    Parameters:

    • symbol (str) – Stock symbol to close.

    • price (float) – Current price of the stock.

    • date (str) – Date and time of the trade.

    Raises:

    KeyError – If the symbol does not have an open position.

    Return type:

    None

    execute_trade(signal, symbol, price, date)¶

    Executes a trade based on the provided signal.

    Parameters:

    • signal (str) – Trading signal (‘BUY’ or ‘SELL’).

    • symbol (str) – Stock symbol to trade.

    • price (float) – Current price of the stock.

    • date (str) – Date and time of the trade.

    Raises:

    ValueError – If an invalid signal is provided.

    Return type:

    None

    fetch_current_balance()¶

    Fetches the current balance from the brokerage account in LIVE mode.

    Note: This method should be implemented to integrate with a real brokerage API.

    Returns:

    Current account balance.

    Return type:

    float

    Raises:

    NotImplementedError – If not implemented.

    load_positions()¶

    Loads existing positions from a JSON file in LIVE mode.

    Returns:

    Dictionary of current positions per symbol.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, Any]

    Raises:

    • FileNotFoundError – If the positions file does not exist.

    • json.JSONDecodeError – If the positions file contains invalid JSON.

    open_position(position_type, symbol, price, date)¶

    Opens a new position (long or short) for a given symbol.

    Parameters:

    • position_type (str) – Type of position (‘long’ or ‘short’).

    • symbol (str) – Stock symbol to trade.

    • price (float) – Entry price of the stock.

    • date (str) – Date and time of the trade.

    Raises:

    ValueError – If the position type is invalid or insufficient capital.

    Return type:

    None

    record_trade(action, position_type, symbol, price, shares, date, entry_date=None)¶

    Records a trade action in the trade history.

    Parameters:

    • action (str) – Action type (‘OPEN’ or ‘CLOSE’).

    • position_type (str) – Type of position (‘long’ or ‘short’).

    • symbol (str) – Stock symbol traded.

    • price (float) – Trade execution price.

    • shares (int) – Number of shares traded.

    • date (str) – Date and time of the trade.

    • entry_date (Optional[str], optional) – Entry date for ‘CLOSE’ actions. Defaults to None.

    Return type:

    None

    update_positions_file()¶

    Updates the positions file by saving the current positions to a JSON file.

    Raises:

    IOError – If the file cannot be written.

    Return type:

    None
